member.summary: Gets the keyboard value for a or event.

member.summary: Gets the key data for a or event.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.Windows.NKeyEventArgs.Modifiers

member.remarks: By default all chart objects have the default cursor so you must also modify the Cursor property of the objects that you want to change the mouse cursor.

member.summary: Creates a new NCursorTool object.
member.remarks: You must add the object to the Tools of the chart controller in order to enable the cursor change feature.

member.summary: Base for all tools that use attributes from the NInteractivityStyle object.

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.Windows.NTooltipTool
member.summary: When present in the Tools collection instructs the control to display tooltips for the chart elements that have an assigned tooltip.

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.Windows.NTooltipTool.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new NTooltipTool object with default settings.
member.remarks: This constructor sets AutoPopDelay to 5000ms, InitialDelay to 500ms and Reshow delay to 100ms.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.Windows.NTooltipTool.AutoPopDelay
member.summary: Controls the period of time the tooltips remain visible if the mouse pointer is stationary within the chart.
member.remarks: This property enables you to shorten or lengthen the time that the tooltip window is displayed when the mouse pointer is over a control. For example, if you display extensive help in a tooltip window, you can increase the value of this property to ensure that the user has sufficient time to read the text.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.Windows.NTooltipTool.InitialDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the time that passes before the tooltip appears.
member.remarks: This property enables you to shorten or lengthen the time that the chart control waits before displaying a tooltip window. If the value of the InitialDelay property is set to a value that is too long in duration, the user of your application may not know that your application provides tooltip help. You can use this property to ensure that the user has tooltips displayed quickly by shortening the time specified.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.Windows.NTooltipTool.ReshowDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time that must transpire before subsequent tooltip windows appear as the mouse pointer moves from one chart element to another.
member.remarks: This property enables you to shorten or lengthen the time that the tooltip waits before displaying a tooltip window after a previous tooltip window is displayed. The first time a tooltip window is displayed the value of the InitialDelay property is used to determine the delay to apply before initially showing the tooltip window. When a tooltip window is currently being displayed and the user moves the cursor to another chart element or control that displays a tooltip window, the value of the ReshowDelay property is used before showing the tooltip for the new control. The tooltip window from the previous control must still be displayed in order for the delay specified in the ReshowDelay property to be used; otherwise the InitialDelay property value is used.

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.Windows.NTooltipTool.GetTooltipFromPoint(Nevron.GraphicsCore.NPointF)
member.summary: Gets the tooltip from the specified mouse position

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NSettings
member.summary: Controls settings related to the chart rendering and scaling like antialiasing, jittering and 2D object scaling.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSettings.EnableJittering
member.summary: This property is deprecated. You should use the JitterMode property.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSettings.JitterMode
member.summary: Controls the jittering mode (full context antialiasing) feature of the control.
member.remarks: Jittering or blurring is an efficient way to antialias the whole context including polygons. In some cases it can also produce images with better quality that antialiasing because it antialiases polygons also. The idea behind jittering is very simple and this why this special visual effect is so effective. Instead of rendering the context only once the control renders it several times and produces different image samples of the image. All these samples have a small offset along the X and Y directions. The samples are added together with weight coefficients to produce the final image. Jittering is turned off by default.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSettings.AutoJitterInterval
member.summary: Controls the time period (in ms) to wait until an auto jitter occurs.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSettings.AnimationInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the animation interval in milliseconds

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSettings.JitteringDeviation
member.summary: The maximum deviation of the jittering samples from the original image in pixels.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is 1. Greater values produce a more blurred image.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSettings.JitteringSteps
member.summary: The number of image samples rendered by the control to produce a jittered image.
member.remarks: The values of this property range from 2 to 16 and greater values produce a better blurring effect. The default value is 2.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSettings.ShapeRenderingMode
member.summary: Controls the antialising (smoothing) feature of the control.
member.remarks: Nevron Chart for .NET can antialias the lines and points rendered by the control. This property is set to SmoothingMode.AntiAlias by default. You may wish to turn off the antialising to increase the performance.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSettings.TextRenderingHint
member.summary: Controls the text rendering hint (antialising) applied to text in the control.
member.remarks: This property is set to TextRenderingHint.SystemDefault by default.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSettings.RenderSurface
member.summary: Whether or not to render the chart to a bitmap or use a double buffer window.
member.remarks: OpenGL supports rendering in a GDI bitmap or Win32 window specially configured for OpenGL rendering. In Window mode the chart will automatically leverage the video board 3D acceleration. Because it is not guaranteed that the video drivers are up to date, the control uses by the default the slower but more robust mode GDI bitmap. You may instruct the chart to render to a window at any time by setting the RenderToBitmap property to false.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSettings.TransparentBackground
member.summary: Controls the opacity of the background.
member.remarks: When set to true the NBackgroundStyle object of the chart will not be rendered resulting in a transparent background. Note that rendering with transparent background is slower.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSettings.MinLineHitTestWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimim line width acceptable for hit testing
member.remarks: By default this property is set to 3 thus allowing the end user to easily select tiny lines.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSettings.MultiThreadMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the multithread mode of the control

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.Functions.NArgumentCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of NDataSeries objects which participate in a function expression as arguments (data sources). Each NFunctionCalculator object has an associated argument collection.

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.Functions.NArgumentCollection.Add(Nevron.Chart.NDataSeriesDouble)
member.summary: Adds a new argument to the collection. All the data series that participate in a function expression must be added to the collection before calculating the function.
member.remarks: The names of the data series in the argument collection must be unique so sometimes it may be necessary to rename a data series before adding it. The names can contain all kinds of characters except '{' and '}'. They cannot consist of whitespaces only.
member.param: The data series object to be added to the collection.

member.summary: Removes the argument at the specified index from the collection.

member.summary: Removes all elements from the collection.

member.summary: Checks if the current argument collection and the current expression are valid.
member.exception: Raised if there are some invalid arguments or a syntax error in the expression.

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.Functions.NFunctionCalculator.Calculate
member.summary: Calculates a function which is defined by the current expression and arguments.
member.exception: Raised if there are some invalid arguments or a syntax error in the expression.
member.returns: The function returns an NDataSeries object which contains the result of the calculation. If the expression is empty the function returns null.

member.summary: Thrown when an error occures in the function calculation.

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NModParentOrderSelector
member.summary: Represents a mod parent order selector
member.remarks:
This selector will match when the index of the chart element in its parent, divided by the modFactor equals value:
indexInParent % modFactor == value

member.remarks: The applicators will be applied only if the selector matches the passed chart element. You may group several rules in a style sheet object and then apply it to chart documents. For more information check the NStyleSheet class description.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NImageMapDockPanel.CacheSelectionRendering
member.summary: Whether or not to cache the internal image map created by the panel.
member.remarks: When you use an interactivity operations like tooltips, events and cursors the control internally performs a render to determine the chart object under the mouse cursor. This render is cached for reuse by default, which greatly improves the speed of subsequent interactivity requests. The generated image map is automatically updated when you refresh the chart or drag it with the trackball. You may wish to turn off this cache to reduce the memory footprint of the control.

member.summary: Invalidates the cached image map and refreshes all child panels.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NContentPanel.BoundsMode
member.summary: Defines the mode used to fit the panel contents into the panel bounds.
member.remarks:
The possible values for this property are BoundsMode.None, BoundsMode.Stretch and BoundsMode.Fit.
None - the panel will not try to align the contents to the panel bounds.
Fit - the panel will stretch the contents along X and Y in order to fill as much as possible of the panel area preserving the contents proportions.
Stretch - the panel will stretch the contents along X and Y in order to fill as much as possible of the panel area without breaking outside. This bounds mode does not preserve the panel contents proportions.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NContentPanel.PositionChildPanelsInContentBounds
member.summary: When set to true child panels that use docking will use the panel content bounds instead of the panel bounds.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NContentPanel.Padding
member.summary: Gets or sets the padding applied to the panel
member.remarks: The padding controls the distance between the panel border and its content

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NContentPanel.Margins
member.summary: Gets or sets the margins applied to the panel
member.remarks: The margins control the distance between the panel bounds and the border (or content if there is no border style)

member.remarks: To enable this type of automatic docking for a given axis you have to create an instance of the NAutoDockAxisAnchor type and assign it to the Anchor property of the axis.

member.summary: Gets or sets an enum value that specifies preferences for automatic selection of dock zones.
member.remarks: The automatic dock axis anchor dynamicaly chooses the most suitable dock zone for an axis, taking into account the current projection. The ZonePreference value helps the anchor decide which axis dock zone to choose when there are two options for the given projection state.

member.remarks: This property takes effect only when the property CreateNewZoneLevel is set to true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NDockAxisAnchorBase.AfterSpace
member.summary: Specifies spacing that should be leaved after the level of the axis before other levels are added in the zone.
member.remarks: This property takes effect only when the property CreateNewZoneLevel is set to true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NDockAxisAnchorBase.CreateNewZoneLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this anchor will create a new zone level for the axis or use the last created one.
member.remarks: If there are no levels in the zone the anchor will always create a zone level. Note that the BeforeSpace and AfterSpace properties depend on the value of this property.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NAutoSideAxisAnchor.PreferredSide
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies a preferred side for an axis.
member.remarks: The automatic dock axis anchor dynamicaly chooses a dock zone for an axis, taking into account the current projection and the side preference. For an arbitrary 3D view there are two possible edges of the chart box that can host an axis. One of them is named "Primary" and the other "Secondary". This property determines which of these edges is selected for the axis. For example: for a Y axis the left side of the chart is primary, and the right side is secondary. If you choose the primary side the Y axis will always be displayed to the left, no matter how the chart is rotated.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NDockTernaryAxisAnchor.AfterSpace
member.summary: Specifies spacing that should be leaved after the level of the axis before other levels are added in the zone.
member.remarks: This property takes effect only when the property CreateNewZoneLevel is set to true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NDockTernaryAxisAnchor.CreateNewZoneLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this anchor will create a new zone level for the axis or use the last created one.
member.remarks: If there are no levels in the zone the anchor will always create a zone level. Note that the BeforeSpace and AfterSpace properties depend on the value of this property.

member.summary: Controls the width of the bars in NLength format, when the series is in X scatter mode.
member.remarks: By default set to 2 percent of the chart area.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NFastBarSeries.BarDepth
member.summary: Controls the depth of the bars in NLength format, when the series is in Z scatter mode.
member.remarks: By default set to 2 percent of the chart area

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NFastBarSeries.WidthPercent
member.summary: Controls the width of the bars in percents of the floor grid cell width.
member.remarks: By default set to 70.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NFastBarSeries.DepthPercent
member.summary: Controls the depth of bars in percents of the floor grid cell depth.
member.remarks: By default set to 50.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NFastBarSeries.Color
member.summary: Controls the point color

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NFastBarSeries.Origin
member.summary: Specifies the bars origin value when the UseOrigin is set to true.
member.remarks: By default 0.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NFastBarSeries.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the NGridSurfaceData object controlling the surface data storage.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NFastBarSeries.OriginMode
member.summary: Specifies which value should be used as a bar origin.
member.remarks:
If this property is set to SeriesOriginMode.CustomOrigin the bar origin is specified by the Origin property. If this property is set to SeriesOriginMode.MaxValue the origin is the max value of the bar series. If this property is set to SeriesOriginMode.MinValue the origin is the min value of the bar series.
By default this property is set to SeriesOriginMode.CustomOrigin.

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NGridSurfaceSeries
member.summary: Represents a grid surface series.

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NGridSurfaceSeries.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NGridSurfaceSeries.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the NGridSurfaceData object controlling the surface data storage.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NGridSurfaceSeries.OriginX
member.summary: Gets or sets the X origin value of the surface. UseCustomXOriginAndStep must be set to true for this property to take effect.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NGridSurfaceSeries.OriginZ
member.summary: Gets or sets the Z origin value of the surface. UseCustomZOriginAndStep must be set to true for this property to take effect.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NGridSurfaceSeries.StepX
member.summary: Gets or sets the step of the surface grid in the X direction. UseCustomXOriginAndStep must be set to true for this property to take effect.
member.remarks: Only positive values are allowed. Negative values are taken by absolute value.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NGridSurfaceSeries.StepZ
member.summary: Gets or sets the step of the surface grid in the Z direction. UseCustomZOriginAndStep must be set to true for this property to take effect.
member.remarks: Only positive values are allowed. Negative values are taken by absolute value.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NGridSurfaceSeries.UseCustomXOriginAndStep
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies how surface X values are calculated.
member.remarks: This property is kept for backward compatibility, use the XValuesMode property instead. Setting UseCustomXOriginAndStep to false is equivalent to XValuesMode = GridSurfaceValuesMode.Natural. Setting UseCustomXOriginAndStep to true is equivalent to XValuesMode = GridSurfaceValuesMode.OriginAndStep.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NGridSurfaceSeries.UseCustomZOriginAndStep
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies how surface Z values are calculated.
member.remarks: This property is kept for backward compatibility, use the ZValuesMode property instead. Setting UseCustomZOriginAndStep to false is equivalent to ZValuesMode = GridSurfaceValuesMode.Natural. Setting UseCustomZOriginAndStep to true is equivalent to ZValuesMode = GridSurfaceValuesMode.OriginAndStep.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NGridSurfaceSeries.XValuesMode
member.summary: Specifies the mode for the surface X values.
member.remarks: If set to GridSurfaceValuesMode.Natural (default) the grid's X origin is 0 and the grid's step in the Z direction is equal to 1. If set to GridSurfaceValuesMode.OriginAndStep the X values of the surface data points are calculated from the OriginX and StepX values. If set to GridSurfaceValuesMode.CustomValues the X values are taken from the XValues data series.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NGridSurfaceSeries.ZValuesMode
member.summary: Specifies the mode for the surface Z values.
member.remarks: If set to GridSurfaceValuesMode.Natural (default) the surface is positioned behind the last series along the Depth axis and the grid step in the Z direction is equal to 1. If set to GridSurfaceValuesMode.OriginAndStep the Z values of the surface data points are calculated from the OriginZ and StepZ values. If set to GridSurfaceValuesMode.CustomValues the Z values are taken from the ZValues data series.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NGridSurfaceSeries.XValues
member.summary: Gets or sets the data series holding the custom X values for the grid surface.
member.remarks: The data series contains Double values. The values must be sorted in ascending order (otherwise the control sorts them internally).

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NGridSurfaceSeries.ZValues
member.summary: Gets or sets the data series holding the custom Z values for the grid surface.
member.remarks: The data series contains Double values. The values must be sorted in ascending order (otherwise the control sorts them internally).

member.summary: Gets the contour for the specified y value

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NSurfaceSeriesBase
member.summary: Abstract base class for the NGridSurfaceSeries, NMeshSurfaceSeries and NTriangulatedSurfaceSeries. This class contains common functionality for the surface series like surface palette management, control of the surface filling, frame, flat surface mode etc.

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NSurfaceSeriesBase.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NSurfaceSeriesBase.GetAttributeByNameAt(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an an attribute by its name and index

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSurfaceSeriesBase.Palette
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom palette associated with the surface. To make the chart use the custom palette you have to set the AutomaticPalette property to false.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSurfaceSeriesBase.SmoothPalette
member.summary: When this property is enabled the zone colors gradate smoothly from one to another.
member.remarks: By default this property is set to false. This property is deprecated. Use Palette.SmoothPalette instead.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSurfaceSeriesBase.AutomaticPalette
member.summary: When set to true the component uses automatically generated surface palette. When set to False the component uses a custom defined palette (the Palette property gets or sets the custom palette).
member.remarks: By default the automatic palette is enabled. This property is deprecated. Use Palette.Mode instead.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSurfaceSeriesBase.SyncPaletteWithAxisScale
member.summary: Synchronizes the number of palette entries in the automatic palette with the current scale of the vertical axis on which the series is displayed. Valid only when AutomaticPalette is set to true. Otherwise the PaletteSteps property is considered.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSurfaceSeriesBase.PaletteSteps
member.summary: Controls the number of entries in the automatic palette if the SyncPaletteWithAxisScale is set to false. Valid only if AutomaticPalette is set to true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSurfaceSeriesBase.AutoPaletteColors
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of colors that are used for the automatic palette. Valid only if AutomaticPalette is set to true.
member.remarks: This property is deprecated. Use Palette.AutoPaletteColors

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSurfaceSeriesBase.FrameStrokeStyle
member.summary: Controls the appearance of the surface frame lines and dots.
member.remarks: The color of the frame lines is defined by the FrameStrokeStyle object only when the FrameColorMode is set to SurfaceFrameColorMode.Uniform.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSurfaceSeriesBase.FillStyle
member.summary: Controls the fill style applied to the surface. You can modify the surface filling transparency, material properties like specular color, emissive color, shininess, as well as apply textures, gradients and patterns to the surface.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSurfaceSeriesBase.FillMode
member.summary: Controls the way in which the surface is filled. Currently there are two filling modes: zone filling and no filling.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSurfaceSeriesBase.FrameMode
member.summary: Controls the surface frame mode. Supported values are: SurfaceFrameMode.None - no frame at all SurfaceFrameMode.Mesh - frame connecting the adjacent data points SurfaceFrameMode.Contour - contour lines at specific surface elevations SurfaceFrameMode.MeshContour - mixed mesh and contour frame SurfaceFrameMode.Dots - dots at the data points

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSurfaceSeriesBase.FrameColorMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the coloring mode for the surface frame lines.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSurfaceSeriesBase.ValueFormatter
member.summary: Gets or sets the NValueFormatter object controlling the formatting of the elevation (Y) values.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSurfaceSeriesBase.DrawFlat
member.summary: Draws the surface in flat mode (contour chart). The PositionMode and PositionValue properties determine the vertical position of the surface.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSurfaceSeriesBase.DrawContourBorder
member.summary: Whether to draw the contour border

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSurfaceSeriesBase.PositionMode
member.summary: The PositionMode property controls the vertical position of the surface, when it is rendered in flat mode (DrawFlat property is set to True).

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSurfaceSeriesBase.PositionValue
member.summary: The PositionValue property specifies the value for the vertical position of the surface when the DrawFlat property is set to True and the PositionMode is SurfacePositionMode.CustomValue.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSurfaceSeriesBase.InteractivityStyles
member.summary: Gets/sets the interactivity styles data series

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSurfaceSeriesBase.TexturePlaneMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the current mode of the texture mapping plane. The texture mapping plane defines how image and gradient fill styles are projected on the surface. The user can chose between the XZ, XY and ZY planes.
member.remarks: The default texture plane is the XZ plane.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSurfaceSeriesBase.CustomTexturePlane
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom texture mapping plane.
member.remarks: The custom texture mapping plane is defined by three points in 3D space.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSurfaceSeriesBase.ShadingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the surface shading mode.
member.remarks: The shading mode determines how the lighting calculations for the surface are performed. By default this property is set to ShadingMode.Flat. Currently it takes effect only for the NTriangulatedSurfaceSeries type.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSurfaceSeriesBase.Isolines
member.summary: Represents the collection of isolines

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the min max of the node is valid

member.summary: Whether the surface is rendered as flat

member.summary: Whether to draw contour border around the surface

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NFibonacciArcs
member.summary: Represents the Fibonacci Arcs line study.
member.remarks: Fibonacci arcs are created by drawing an invisible trendline between two points, and then drawing three curves that intersect this trendline at the key Fibonacci levels of 38.2%, 50% and 61.8%. Fibonacci Arcs are considered to represent potential support and resistance levels. Fibonacci Arcs and Fibonacci Fans are usually plotted together on the chart. Support and resistance levels are determined by the points of intersection of these lines.

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NFibonacciArcs.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the NFibonacciArcs type.

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NFibonacciArcs.GetSeriesType
member.summary: Gets the series type

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NFibonacciFans
member.summary: Represents the Fibonacci Fans line study.
member.remarks: A trend line is drawn between two extreme points. Then an invisible vertical line is drawn through the second extreme point. Three trend lines are drawn from the first extreme point, so that they intersect the invisible vertical line at Fibonacci levels of 38.2%, 50%, and 61.8%. These lines are considered to represent support and resistance levels. For getting a more precise forecast, it is recommended to use other Fibonacci instruments along with the Fan.

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NFibonacciFans.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the NFibonacciFans type.

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NFibonacciFans.GetSeriesType
member.summary: Gets the series type

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NFibonacciRetracements
member.summary: Represents the Fibonacci Retracements line study.
member.remarks: Fibonacci Retracements are nine horizontal lines intersecting the trend line between two points at Fibonacci levels of 0.0%, 23.6%, 38.2%, 50%, 61.8%, 100%, 161.8%, 261.8%, and 423.6%. After a significant change, prices often return to their previous levels correcting an essential part of their initial movement. Prices often face support/resistance at the level of Fibonacci Retracements or near them in the course of such a movement.

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NFibonacciRetracements.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the NFibonacciRetracements type.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NFibonacciRetracements.RetracementsStrokeStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the stroke style applied to the retracement lines.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NFibonacciRetracements.Infinite
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether the retracements are displayed as infinite lines over the X dimension.
member.remarks: By default this property is set to true.

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NFibonacciRetracements.GetSeriesType
member.summary: Gets the series type

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NQuadrantLines
member.summary: Represents the Quadrant Lines line study.
member.remarks: Quadrant Lines are a series of horizontal lines that divide the space between highest and lowest values into four equal sections. They are primarily intended to aid in the visual inspection of price movements.

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NQuadrantLines.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the NQuadrantLines type.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NQuadrantLines.CentralLineStrokeStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the stroke style applied to the 50% line.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NQuadrantLines.Infinite

member.remarks: By default this property is set to true.

member.remarks: By default the arrowhead height factor is set to 0.1, which means that the arrowhead height is one tenth of the vector length in model units.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Values data series.
member.remarks: The Values data series is of type double and is used by all derived classes. It stores the most important information of a series. For example the NPieSeries stores the values of the pies, and the NBarSeries strores the values of the bars.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NQuickPointSeries.UseXValues
member.summary: Specifies whether the series should use custom X positions for the data points.
member.remarks: You must manually change the mode of the horizontal axis on which the series is displayed in order to properly scale it.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Data Series that holds the X values of the data points.
member.remarks: The XValues are taken into account only if the UseXValues property is set to true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NQuickPointSeries.UseZValues
member.summary: Specifies whether custom Z positions should be used.
member.remarks: If this property is set to true the data items use the coordinates contained in the ZValues data series as their depth coordinate. It is recommended to switch the scale mode of the depth axis to one of the value scale modes.

member.returns: reference to the resulting data set

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NDataSeriesDouble.Evaluate(System.String,Nevron.Chart.NDataSeriesSubset)
member.summary: This method evaluates a single argument function on the specified data series subset.
member.param:
This argument supports the following string constants:
MIN returns the minimum value contained in the subset
MAX returns the maximum value contained in the subset
AVE returns the average value of the subset
SUM returns the sum of all values contained in the subset
ABSSUM returns the absolute sum of all values contained in the subset
FIRST returns the data series value at the first index in the subset
LAST returns the data series value at the last index in the subset
subset in the data series on which to perform the evaluation

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NChartLabelLayoutSettings
member.summary: Controls options related to data label layout on a per chart level.
member.remarks: This object is relevant for Cartesian, Polar and Radar charts.

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NChartLabelLayoutSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NChartLabelLayoutSettings.EnableInitialPositioning
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether initial label positioning is enabled.
member.remarks: If this property is set to true the control automatically chooses an initial position for each label so that there are minimum overlaps. The layout selects one of positions that are proposed by the series that owns the label. In case this property is set to false, the default position is used for each label.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NChartLabelLayoutSettings.RemoveOverlappedLabels
member.summary: Gets or sets a property indicating whether labels that overlap after initial label positioning should be removed from display.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NChartLabelLayoutSettings.EnableLabelAdjustment
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether label position adjustment is enabled.
member.remarks: If this property is set to true the control adjusts the label positions after the initial placement. Labels can be moved in any direction to avoid overlapping.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NChartLabelLayoutSettings.MaxLayoutItems
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of items (labels and obstacles) that can be processed by the automatic layout system.
member.remarks: If the number of layout items in the chart exceeds this value, automatic layout is not performed.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NChartLabelLayoutSettings.MinLabelDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of the minimum label distance in case labels are instructed to not overlap

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesLabelLayoutSettings
member.summary: Controls options related to data label layout on a per series level.

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesLabelLayoutSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesLabelLayoutSettings.EnableDataPointSafeguard
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether data points of this series are protected from being overlapped by labels.
member.remarks: If this property is set to false the data points of this series can be overlapped by data labels. Otherwise the data points protect their characteristic points (like min and max) from being overlapped.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesLabelLayoutSettings.DataPointSafeguardSize
member.summary: Specifies the size of the safeguard area that protects data points from being overlaped by labels.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesLabelLayoutSettings.LabelLocations
member.summary: Gets or sets an array that contains possible initial label locations that are used by the label layout system.
member.remarks: The locations are taken into account when the EnableInitialPositioning property of the chart's LabelLayoutSettings object is set to true and the UseLabelLocations property is set to true. If the initial label positioning is disabled for this chart or for this series, then the standard label location is used for each label, as specified by the relevant NDataLabelStyle object.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesLabelLayoutSettings.UseLabelLocations
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the initial locations in the LabelLocations collection should be used.
member.remarks: This property can enable or disable the initial label positioning on a per-series basis. If initial positioning is disabled the initial location of each label is specified by the respective NDataLabelStyle object.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesLabelLayoutSettings.InvertLocationsForInvertedDataPoints
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether label locations should be inverted vertically for data points with inverted vertical orientation.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesLabelLayoutSettings.OutOfBoundsLocationMode
member.summary: Specifies the treatment mode for locations that fall partially out of the plot bounds.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesLabelLayoutSettings.InvertLocationsIfIgnored
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether proposed label locations should be inverted if all of them are outside the chart bounds and are ignored.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NDockPolarAxisAnchor.AfterSpace
member.summary: Specifies spacing that should be leaved after the level of the axis before other levels are added in the zone.
member.remarks: This property takes effect only when the property CreateNewZoneLevel is set to true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NDockPolarAxisAnchor.CreateNewZoneLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this anchor will create a new zone level for the axis or use the last created one.
member.remarks: If there are no levels in the zone the anchor will always create a zone level. Note that the BeforeSpace and AfterSpace properties depend on the value of this property.

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NPolarAxis
member.summary: Represents a polar axis.
member.remarks:
The chart has one polar axis on which all polar series are always scaled The following code obtains the polar axis of the chart
Dim polarAxis As NPolarAxis = CType(NChart.Axis(StandardAxis.Polar), NPolarAxis)
NPolarAxis polarAxis = (NPolarAxis)NChart.Axis(StandardAxis.Polar);
The polar axis exposes polar specific functionality.

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NRadarAxis
member.summary: Represents a radar axis.
member.remarks:
The chart has one radar axis on which all radar series are always scaled The following code obtains the radar axis of the chart
Dim radarAxis As NRadarAxis = CType(chart.Axis(StandardAxis.Radar), NRadarAxis)
NRadarAxis radarAxis = (NRadarAxis)chart.Axis(StandardAxis.Radar);
The radar axis exposes radar specific functionality.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value in the range [0, 1] that controls the arrowhead width. The width is relative to the vector length.
member.remarks: By default the arrowhead height factor is set to 0.05, which means that the arrowhead height is 5 percent of the vector length in model units.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NVectorSeries.ArrowheadHeightFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value in the range [0, 1] that controls the arrowhead height. The height is relative to the vector length.
member.remarks: By default the arrowhead height factor is set to 0.1, which means that the arrowhead height is one tenth of the vector length in model units.

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NAngularScaleConfigurator
member.summary: Represents a scale configurator that will configure the scale to display angular values.
member.remarks: By default the scale will try to decorate the major ticks using a divisor step for the specified cycle length. For example if you specifiy 90 degrees for cycle length the steps that will be considered are 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 9, 10, 15, 18, 30, 45 and 90 as they represent the possible divisors of 90.

member.summary: Implements angle serialization in XML

member.summary: Specifies the minor ticks when AutoMinor ticks is set to false

member.summary: Gets or sets the array of major ticks.

member.summary: Gets or sets the cycle length of the scale.

member.returns: true if the stripe is shown, false if not

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NAxisStripe.SetShowAtWall(Nevron.Chart.ChartWallType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Show the stripe on the specified chart wall.
member.exception: Raised if a chart wall, which is invalid for this stipe was specified
member.remarks:
The component will raise an exception if you try to display the stripe on an invalid wall.
For the vertical axis stripes allowed chart walls are the vertical walls.
For the horizontal axis stripes allowed chart walls are the back, front and floor walls.
For the depth axis stripes allowed chart walls are the left, rigth and floor walls.
member.param: specifies whether to show the stripe or not

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NAxis
member.summary: The NAxis class is the base class of all axes displayed on charts.
member.remarks:
Each axis displayed by the Nevron Chart for .NET component is represented by a class derived from this class. You can obtain a reference to a standard chart axis with the help of the Axis method of the class. The following code obtains a reference to the PrimaryY axis.
Dim axis As NAxis = NChart.Axis(StandardAxis.PrimaryY);
NAxis axis = NChart.Axis(StandardAxis.PrimaryY);
A reference to a custom axis can be obtained with the help of the second override of the Axis mehtod which receives a Int32 parameter which is the axis id. The following code demonstrates this.
' create a custom vertical axis Dim axis As NAxis = NChart.Axes.AddCustomAxis(AxisOrientation.Vertical,AxisDockZone.FrontRight) ' save the axis id Dim nAxisId As Integer = axis.AxisId ... ' obtain a reference to the axis with the saved id Dim customAxis As NAxis = NChart.Axis(nAxisId)
// create a custom vertical axis NAxis axis = NChart.Axes.AddCustomAxis(AxisOrientation.Vertical, AxisDockZone.FrontRight); // save the axis id int nAxisId = axis.AxisId; ... // obtain a reference to the axis with the saved id NAxis customAxis = NChart.Axis(nAxisId);
The NAxis class implements support for the following axis features:
axis identification each has has an unique id accessible from the AxisId readonly property
appearance control
A set of properties control the visual appearance of the axis. The most important ones are AxisShape, Border, FillStyle and Width
scale control
You can control the axis scale mode as well as access the axis scale object responsible for the respective scaling. The scale mode is determined by the ScaleMode property. You can obtain a reference to the associated scale object with the help of the DimensionScale, NumericScale, LogarithmicScale and DataTimeScale properties respectively.
major and minor tick control You can control the appearance and the length of the major and minor ticks.
major and minor gridline control You can control the appearance of the major and minor gridlines as well as control on which chart walls they are displayed
position control
You can specify the position of the axis. The PredefinedPosition property specifies a predefined axis position, while the PositionOffset property determines an offset from this position.
text format control You can control the formatting of the values. The ValueFormatter property controls the applied formatting.
title
You can specify a title string as well as control its appearance. The Title property determines the axis title string. You can control the appearance of the axis title with the help of the NTextStyle object accessible from the TitleTextStyle property.
stagger control you can display the axis texts in stagger mode and control various aspects of this vizualization method. The stagger mode is enabled when the StaggerTexts property is set to true.
access to the associated constant lines you can access the collection of contant lines associated with this axis with the help of the ConstLines property
access to the associated stripe lines you can access the collection of stripe lines associated with this axis with the help of the Stripes property

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NDataPoint
member.summary: A data point is a logical union of values that are displayed as a particular object in the chart. Data points are represented by instances of the NDataPoint class.
member.remarks: NDataPoint objects are not premanently stored in the chart. They are only used to transfer the series values from your application to the chart. Internally the data is stored in data series.

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NIndexedDataSeries
member.summary: Indexed data series are map-like collections that are designed to store chart data in a memory-efficient way. Each collection item is a key and value pair, where the key is the data point index. Indexed data series are primarily used to store complex data types. They are represented by the NIndexedDataSeries class.

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NIndexedDataSeries.Add(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds an item (key-value pair) to the data series.
member.remarks: You can use this method instead of the indexer in case you have to add multiple data items one after another. This method is faster, but is not as safe as the indexer. You have to make sure that the key parameter that you pass is unique within the collection.
member.param: the index of the data point
The actual data point value. If this parameter is null or DBNull.Value, the item is not added to the data series.

member.param: identifies the item to be removed

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NChart
member.summary: NChart is the primary object controlling a chart displayed in the control canvas. This is the base class for different charting types like Cartesian Chart, Pie Chart, Polar Chart, etc. It provides basic functionality like control over the chart dimensions, projection and light model. It also exposes the series, axes and walls collections.

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NMarkerStyle
member.summary: Controls the appearance of a data point marker.
member.remarks:
You can obtain a reference to an instance of this class through the MarkerStyle property of the class. By default the markers are not displayed.
The following code obtains a reference to the default NMarkerStyle object associated with a series.
Dim markerStyle As NMarkerStyle = series.MarkerStyle
NMarkerStyle markerStyle = series.MarkerStyle;

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NAreaSeries
member.summary: Displays an area series.
member.remarks: The NAreaSeries inherits all functionality of its base NXYScatterSeries and displays area segments connecting the adjacent data points. The area begins from an origin value which can be manually specified or calculated automatically.

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NAreaSeries.#ctor
member.summary: Initializer constructor

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NAreaSeries.MultiAreaMode
member.summary: Controls the mode of the area series.
member.remarks: This property determines the way in which the area series interacts with the other created area series. By default set to MultiAreaMode.Series

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NAreaSeries.SamplingMode
member.summary: Whether or not the line series will use sampling

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NAreaSeries.SampleDistance
member.summary: Gets the sample distance when the series uses sampling

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NAreaSeries.AllowNegativeStackValues
member.summary: Whether the series allows negative stack values

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NAreaSeries.GetSeriesType
member.summary: Gets the series type

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NAreaSeriesBase
member.summary: Abstract base class for Area series.

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NAreaSeriesBase.#ctor
member.summary: Default Contructor

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NAreaSeriesBase.OriginMode
member.summary: Specifies which value should be used as an area origin.
member.remarks:
If this property is set to SeriesOriginMode.CustomOrigin the area origin is specified by the Origin property. If this property is set to SeriesOriginMode.MaxValue the origin is the max value of the area. If this property is set to SeriesOriginMode.MinValue the origin is the min value of the area.
By default this property is set to SeriesOriginMode.CustomOrigin.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NAreaSeriesBase.Origin
member.summary: Specifies the area origin value.
member.remarks: This property specifies the origin value when the OriginMode is set to CustomOrigin. The default origin value is 0.

member.summary: Controls the mode of the bar series.
member.remarks: Defines the behaviour of the series in case multiple bar series are created. By default set to Series which means that the bar series is displayed in separate depth space.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NBarSeries.OriginMode
member.summary: Specifies which value should be used as a bar origin.
member.remarks:
If this property is set to SeriesOriginMode.CustomOrigin the bar origin is specified by the Origin property. If this property is set to SeriesOriginMode.MaxValue the origin is the max value of the bar series. If this property is set to SeriesOriginMode.MinValue the origin is the min value of the bar series.
By default this property is set to SeriesOriginMode.CustomOrigin.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NBarSeries.Origin
member.summary: Specifies the bars origin value when the UseOrigin is set to true.
member.remarks: By default 0.

member.summary: Gets or sets the fill style applied to the high areas.
member.remarks: High areas are areas for which the high value is greater than the low value.
member.example:
The following code will display the high areas in blue color.
highlow.HighFillStyle = new NColorFillStyle(Color.Blue);

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NHighLowSeries.HighBorderStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the stroke style applied to the high area borders.
member.remarks: High areas are areas for which the high value is larger than the low value.
member.example:
The following code will display the high areas with green border color.
highlow.HighBorderStyle.Color= Color.Green;

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NHighLowSeries.LowFillStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the fill style applied to the low areas.
member.remarks: Low areas are areas for which the high value is smaller than the low value.
member.example:
The following code will display the low areas in magenta color.
highlow.LowFillStyle = new NColorFillStyle(Color.Magenta);

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NHighLowSeries.LowBorderStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the stroke style applied to the low areas.
member.remarks: Low areas are areas for which the high value is smaller than the low value.
member.example:
The following code will display the low areas with red border color.

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NSeries
member.summary: NSeries is the base class of all series with one dimensional value arrays.
member.remarks:
The NSeries class inherits all functionality of the NSeriesBase class and adds support for the following features:
control over the appearance of the series
Implemented by the FillStyle and BorderStyle properties.
control over the series data labels
Implemented by the DataLabelStyle and DataLabelStyles properties
control over the series markers
Implemented by the MarkerStyle and the MarkerStyles properties.
control over the series interactivity
Implemented by the NInteractivityStyle and the NInteractivityStyles properties.
support for Values and Labels data series accessible by the Values and Labels properties respectively.
control over the series interactivity implemented by the attached NSeriesInteractivity object accessible from the Interactivity property.
support for total, percent, cumulative and index format commands
you can use the <total>, <percent>, <cumulative> and <index> formatting commands in the Format property of the NDataLabelStyle and NSeriesLegend classes if you wants to display the total, percent, cumulative or index value respectively
control over the formatting of the total, percent, cumulative and index formatting commands
you can access the repsective NValueFormatter object from the TotalValueFormatter, PercentValueFormatter, CumulativeValueFormatter and IndexValueFormatter properties.
helper methods for feeding data to the data series the Add methods have different sets of data series values and thus support different data feeding scenarios

member.summary: Default constructor

member.summary: Gets or sets the data point origin index

member.summary: Gets or sets the object controlling the appearance of the empty data points.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeries.Clip
member.summary: Gets or sets the object controlling the visible box of the series data. You can use this object to clip parts of the series content.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeries.InfinityDataPointsAppearance
member.summary: Gets or sets the object controlling the appearance of infinite data points.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeries.FillStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the default fill style applied to the series.
member.remarks: The NFillStyle object accessible through this method specifies the default filling of the series data points. This fill style can be replaced for each individual data point by adding NFillStyle objects to the FillStyles data series.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeries.BorderStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the default stroke style applied to the series borders.
member.remarks: The NStrokeStyle object accessible through this method specifies the default border style of the series data points. This border style can be replaced for each individual data point by adding NStrokeStyle objects to the BorderStyles data series.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeries.DataLabelStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the NDataLabelStyle object controlling the default appearance of the data point labels.
member.remarks: The data labels are explanatory texts displayed for the series data points. The NDataLabelStyle class controls their appearance, format, alignment and other related features.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeries.MarkerStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets a NMarkerStyle object controlling the default appearance of the data point markers.
member.remarks: The data point markers are shapes displayed at each data point. You can control various aspects of the markers with the help of the NMarkerStyle class.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeries.FillStyles
member.summary: Gets/sets the fill styles data series. This data series contains individual fill styles for the data items.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeries.BorderStyles
member.summary: Gets/sets the border styles data series. This data series contains individual border styles for the data items.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeries.DataLabelStyles
member.summary: Gets/sets the data labels styles data series. This data series contains individual data label styles for the data items.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeries.MarkerStyles
member.summary: Gets/sets the marker styles data series. This data series contains individual marker styles for the data items.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeries.InteractivityStyles
member.summary: Gets/sets the interactivity styles data series. This data series contains individual interactivity styles for the data items.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeries.Tags
member.summary: Gets/sets the tags data series. This data series contains individual tag objects for the data items.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeries.Values
member.summary: Gets or sets the Values data series.
member.remarks: The Values data series is of type double and is used by all derived classes. It stores the most important information of a series. For example the NPieSeries stores the values of the pies, and the NBarSeries strores the values of the bars.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeries.Labels
member.summary: Gets or sets the labels data series.
member.remarks: The labels data series is of type string and is used to strore the labels of the data points. The labels can be visualized in the data point labels, the chart legend and the data point tooltips.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeries.TotalValueFormatter
member.summary: Gets or sets a NValueFormatter object controlling the formatting of the total values.
member.remarks: The total value formatting command is represented in the formatting strings as <total>. It represents the total sum of the values contained in the Values data series.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeries.PercentValueFormatter
member.summary: Gets or sets a NValueFormatter object controlling the formatting of the percent values.
member.remarks: The percent value formatting command is represented in the formatting strings as <percent>. It represents the percentage of the current data point value to the total value.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeries.CumulativeValueFormatter
member.summary: Gets or sets a NValueFormatter object controlling the formatting of the cumulative values.
member.remarks: The cumulative value formatting command is represented in the format strings as <cumulative>. It represents the cumulative sum accumulated up to the current data point.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeries.IndexValueFormatter
member.summary: Gets or sets a NValueFormatter object controlling the formatting of the index values.
member.remarks: The index value formatting command is represented in the format strings as <index>. It represents the index of the current data point.

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesBase
member.summary: NSeriesBase is the base class of all series.
member.remarks:
It implements support for the following base series functionality.
control over the series visibility implemented by the Visibility property
control over the series name implemented by the Name property
representation of the series in the legend implemented by the attached NSeriesLegend object accessible from the Legend property
scaling of the series on the chart axes implemented by the DisplayOnAxis methods
querying whether a series is scaled on specific axis implemented by the IsDisplayOnAxis methods
uniform access to the data series that the series uses implemented by the GetDataSeries virtual method
control over the appearance of the empty data points implemented by the attached NEmptyDataPointsAppearance object accessible from the EmptyDataPointsAppearance property

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesBase.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesBase.Visible
member.summary: Controls the visibility of the series.
member.remarks: If set to false the series is not displayed and does not affect the scaling of the axes.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesBase.RegardAxisClipping
member.summary: Whether the series regards axis clipping

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesBase.BoxClipping
member.summary: Gets or sets the series box clipping (box volume clipped from the chart area)

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesBase.InflateMargins
member.summary: Inflates the margins of the series to fit the chart area.
member.remarks: This can be very useful if your series has data points which are displayed outside the chart area.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesBase.Legend
member.summary: Gets or sets an instance of the class controlling the representation of the series in the legend.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesBase.ShadowStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the NShadowStyle object controlling the shadow of the series. Shadows are visible when the context is rendered with GDI+.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesBase.InteractivityStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the NInteractivityStyle object controlling the default interactivity features of the data points.
member.remarks:
Each data point displayed by the series has the following interactivity attributes:
tooltip
cursor
url
Open in new window flag

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesBase.AnimationsStyle

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesBase.LabelLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets a NSeriesLabelLayoutSettings object controlling automatic data label layout features.
member.remarks: The settings provided by this object are relevant for Cartesian, Polar and Radar series.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesBase.VerticalAxisRangeMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical axis range mode

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesBase.ZOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets the Z order of the series
member.remarks: Series with equal z order will be rendered in the backward order in which they are present in the series collection. For example the last series, the series before the last and so on until it reaches the first.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesBase.HorizontalAxis
member.summary: Gets the horizontal axis assigned to this series.
member.remarks: This property has effect only after the chart has been recalculated

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesBase.VerticalAxis
member.summary: Gets the vertical axis assigned to this series.
member.remarks: This property has effect only after the chart has been recalculated

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesBase.DepthAxis
member.summary: Gets the depth axis assigned to this series.
member.remarks: This property has effect only after the chart has been recalculated

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesBase.IncludeInXAxisRange
member.summary: Whether the series will affect the x axis range

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesBase.IncludeInYAxisRange
member.summary: Whether the series will affect the x axis range

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesBase.IncludeInZAxisRange
member.summary: Whether the series will affect the x axis range

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesBase.DisplayOnAxis(Nevron.Chart.StandardAxis,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Instructs the chart whether to scale the series on one of the standard chart axes.
member.remarks: By default all series are scaled on the PrimaryX and PrimaryY axes and always on the Depth axis.
member.param:
if true the series is scaled on the specified axis
if false the series is not scaled on the specified axis

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesBase.DisplayOnAxis(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Instruct the chart whether to scale the series on the specified axis.
member.remarks: You can obtain the id of a particular axis with the help of the AxisId property of the NAxis class.
member.param: specifies the id of the targeted axis (standard or custom)

if true the series is scaled on the specified axis
if false the series is not scaled on the specified axis

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesBase.IsDisplayedOnAxis(Nevron.Chart.StandardAxis)
member.summary: Queries whether the series is scaled on the specified standard axis.
member.remarks: By default all series are scaled on the PrimaryY and PrimaryX axes and always on the Depth axis.
member.returns:
true if the series is displayed on the specified standard axis.
false if the series is not displayed on the specified standard axis.

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NSeriesBase.IsDisplayedOnAxis(System.Int32)
member.summary: Query whether the series is displayed on the axis with the specified id.
member.remarks: You can obtain the id of a particular axis with the help of the AxisId property of the NAxis class.
member.param: the id of the axis of interest
member.returns:
true if the series is displayed on the specified standard axis.
false if the series is not displayed on the specified standard axis.

member.summary: Returns a collection of the data series used by the series. The included series are controlled with the included and excluded parameters.
member.remarks: This method can help you obtain a NDataSeriesCollection object containing the data series of a series. The order in which the data series appear in the collection cannot be changed and is specific for each series.
member.param: a bitmask specifying the included series
a bitmask specifying the explicitly excluded series
a flag specifying whether the data series included in the collection must be explicitly aligned

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NXYScatterSeries
member.summary: NXYScatterSeries is a base class for series which support custom X positioning of their data points.
member.remarks:
The NXYScatterSeries class inherits the functionality of the NSeries class and adds support for the following features:
data series containing the custom X data point positions accessible through the XValues property
control whether custom X positions should be used exposed by the UseXValues property

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NXYScatterSeries.#ctor
member.summary: Default Constructor

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NXYScatterSeries.GetDataSeriesInfos
member.summary: Gets the data series infos

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NXYScatterSeries.EnableDepthSort
member.summary: Whether to items in the series must be sorted for display by their depth order.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NXYScatterSeries.UseXValues
member.summary: Specifies whether the series should use custom X positions for the data points.
member.remarks: You must manually change the mode of the horizontal axis on which the series is displayed in order to properly scale it.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NXYScatterSeries.XValues
member.summary: Gets or sets the Data Series that holds the X values of the data points.
member.remarks: The XValues are taken into account only if the UseXValues property is set to true.

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NXYZScatterSeries
member.summary: NXYZScatterSeries is a base class for series which support custom X and Z positioning of their data points.
member.remarks:
The NXYZScatterSeries class inherits the functionality of the NXYScatterSeries class and adds support for the following features:
data series containing the custom Z data point positions accessible through the ZValues property
control whether custom Z positions should be used exposed by the UseZValues property

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NXYZScatterSeries.#ctor
member.summary: Default Constructor

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NXYZScatterSeries.GetDataSeriesInfos
member.summary: Gets the data series infos

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NXYZScatterSeries.UseZValues
member.summary: Specifies whether custom Z positions should be used.
member.remarks: If this property is set to true the data items use the coordinates contained in the ZValues data series as their depth coordinate. It is recommended to switch the scale mode of the depth axis to one of the value scale modes.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NXYZScatterSeries.ZValues
member.summary: Gets or sets the Data Series that holds the Z values of the series data points.
member.remarks: The ZValues are taken into account only if the UseZValues property is set to true.

member.summary: Gets or sets the box size for the point and figure series.
member.remarks: Point and Figure charts display an "X" when prices rise by the box size and display an "O" when prices fall by the box size. No Xs or Os are drawn if prices rise or fall by an amount that is less than the box size.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NPointAndFigureSeries.ReversalAmount
member.summary: Gets or sets the reversal amount for the point and figure series.
member.remarks: In order to change columns (e.g., from an X column to an O column), prices must reverse by the reversal amount multiplied by the box size.

member.remarks: If the property is set to true, the box size is specified in percents of the difference between highest and lowest price. Otherwise the box size is specified as a fixed value. By default this property is set to false.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NSmoothLineSeries.Use1DInterpolationForXYScatter
member.summary: Controls the interpolation method for XY scatter smooth line charts. If this property is set to true, the y values will be regarded as a function of the x values, which means that there will be only one y value for every x coordinate. If the property is set to false, the line will be regarded as a free curve in the XY plane.

member.summary: Controls the depth of the line in percents of the series depth when the LineSegmentShape is set to Tape, Tube or Ellipsoid.
member.remarks: By default set to 50.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStepLineSeries.LineSize
member.summary: If the line segment shape is tube or ellipsoid, this property gets or sets the diameter of the cross section of the tubes / ellipsiods in model units. If the line segment shape is tape and the series works in Z scatter mode, this property gets or sets the depth of the tape in model units. If the line segment shape is simple line, this property doesn't take effect.
member.remarks: By default set to 2.

member.summary: Represents a Three Line Break series.

member.summary: Default constructor.

member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the boxes in percents of the floor grid cell width.
member.remarks: By default set to 70.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NThreeLineBreakSeries.NumberOfLinesToBreak
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of consecutive lines used for the reversal criterion of the line break chart.
member.remarks: If a rally or a sell-off is powerful enough to form several consecutive lines with the same direction, then prices must reverse by the extreme price of the last several lines in order to create a new line. Usually three consecutive lines are used for the reversal criterion, hence the name Three Line Break.

member.summary: Gets or sets the fill style applied to the up boxes.
member.remarks: The up boxes are filled with this fill style.

member.summary: Gets or sets the stroke style applied to the up boxes.
member.remarks: The borders of the up boxes are displayed with this stroke style.

member.remarks: The down boxes are filled with this fill style.

member.summary: Get or sets the stroke style applied to the down boxes.

member.summary: Specifies spacing of the level before the other levels in the zone (if any)
member.remarks: This property takes effect only when the property CreateNewZoneLevel is set to true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NDockGaugeAxisAnchor.AfterSpace
member.summary: Specifies spacing that should be leaved after the level of the axis before other levels are added in the zone.
member.remarks: This property takes effect only when the property CreateNewZoneLevel is set to true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NDockGaugeAxisAnchor.CreateNewZoneLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this anchor will create a new zone level for the axis or use the last created one.
member.remarks: If there are no levels in the zone the anchor will always create a zone level. Note that the BeforeSpace and AfterSpace properties depend on the value of this property.

member.summary: Spacing of the level before content starts

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NLabel
member.summary: This object represents a label. Labels are texts that are always displayed over the 3D context. They usually contain descriptive information about the image generated by the control. You can add labels to the context with the help of the NLabelCollection object. The NLabel object also allows you to position the label at an arbitrary position in the control window. You specify the position (or origin point) of the label object in percents of the control window dimensions with the help of the HorizontalMargin and VerticalMargin properties.

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NLabel.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an empty label.
member.remarks: The label is positioned at the center of the control window.The font is Arial 12.

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NLabel.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a label with the specified text.
member.remarks: The label is positioned at the center of the control window. The font is Arial 12.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NLabel.TextStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the NTextStyle object applied to the label's text.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NLabel.FitMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the label fit mode when BoundsMode is set to Fit

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NLabel.InteractivityStyle
member.summary: The interactivity style associated with the label.
member.remarks: With the NInteractivityStyle object you can control the tooptips, mouse cursor change and browser redirection (HTML image maps only) associated with the label. For more information on the NInteractivityStyle object and the interactivity features take a look at the "Interactivity" book in the Users Guide.

member.summary: Gets or sets the animation style

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NLegend
member.summary: The NLegend class represents the integrated legend of Nevron Chart for .NET.
member.remarks: The integrated legend can display various information about the chart series or custom data. Each chart is associated with only one legend, but one legend can be associated with many charts.

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NLegend.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new legend.
member.remarks: You must add the legend object to the legends collection before it can be displayed by the chart.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NLegend.Mode
member.summary: Controls the mode of the legend.
member.remarks: The integrated legend of Nevron Chart for .NET can operate in three modes - Disabled, Automatic and Manual. In disabled mode the legend is not displayed. When you set the mode to Automatic the legend data is supplied by the series of the associated charts to the legend. In this case you control the displayed legend data items though the NSeriesLegend object. In manual mode you can manually feed the legend data items.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NLegend.Header
member.summary: The header of the legend.
member.remarks: Returns a reference to a NLegendText object representing the legend header. The header is not displayed if the Text property of the NLegendText object is empty.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NLegend.Footer
member.summary: The footer of the legend.
member.remarks: Returns a reference to a NLegendText object representing the legend footer. The footer is not displayed if the Text property of the NLegendText object is empty.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NLegend.Data
member.summary: The legend data when the legend operates in Custom mode.
member.remarks: When you set the legend in custom mode you can manually feed data to the legend by accessing the Array property of the NLegendData object.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NLegend.InteractivityStyle
member.summary: The interactivity style associated with the legend.
member.remarks: With the NInteractivityStyle object you can control the tooptips, mouse cursor change and browser redirection (HTML image maps only) associated with the legend. For more information on the NInteractivityStyle object and the interactivity features take a look at the "Interactivity" book in the Users Guide.

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NWatermark
member.summary: This object represents a watermark. Watermarks are images that are displayed below or on top of all context elements. You can add watermarks to the context with the help of the NWatermarkCollection object. The NWatermark object allows you to position the watermark at an arbitrary position in the control window.

member.summary: Gets or sets the fill style applied to the watermark.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NWatermark.StandardFrameStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the NStandardFrameStyle object controlling the frame of the watermark.
member.remarks: This type of frame resembles the standard Windows frames and can show all types of frames specified by the style of the window (raised, sunken, single etc).

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NWatermark.InteractivityStyle
member.summary: The interactivity style associated with the watermark.
member.remarks: With the NInteractivityStyle object you can control the tooptips, mouse cursor change and browser redirection (HTML image maps only) associated with the watermark. For more information on the NInteractivityStyle object and the interactivity features take a look at the "Interactivity" book in the Users Guide.
