member.remarks: For more information please refer to the Axis Scales topic in the Users Guide.

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.MajorTickMode
member.summary: Controls the mode of the major ticks.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.MaxTickCount
member.summary: Controls the maximum number of major ticks when major tick mode is auto and max tick count mode is MaxCount

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.FixedTickCount
member.summary: Controls the maximum number of ticks when major tick mode is fixed tick count

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.MinTickDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum distance between of ticks on the scale when major tick mode is Auto and max tick count mode is MaxDensity
member.remarks: By default this value is set to 10pt

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.RoundToTickMin
member.summary: Specifies whether the scale should begin from an exact tick value.
member.remarks: This property is deprecated. You should use InflateViewRangeMin in conjunction with ViewRangeInflateMode = ScaleViewRangeInflateMode.MajorTick.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.RoundToTickMax
member.summary: Specifies whether the scale should end on an exact tick value.
member.remarks: This property is deprecated. You should use InflateViewRangeMax in conjunction with ViewRangeInflateMode = ScaleViewRangeInflateMode.MajorTick.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.InflateBeginContentRangeWithCustomTicks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether custom ticks will inflate the scale end content range

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.InflateEndContentRangeWithCustomTicks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether custom ticks will inflate the scale begin content range

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.InnerMinorTickStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the style off the inner minor tick lines

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.OuterMinorTickStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the style off the outer minor tick lines

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.MinorTickCount
member.summary: Specifies the number of minor ticks between two major ones.
member.remarks: By default set to 0 (no minor ticks).

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.AutoMinorTicks
member.summary: Specifies whether minor ticks are automatically generated.
member.remarks: By default set to true. If set to false the minor ticks are displayed at values specified by the array accessible with the help of the MinorTicks property of the NAxis class.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.AutoLabels
member.summary: Specifies whether the scale should produce automatic labels.
member.remarks: By default set to true. The generated labels are displayed on the major tick marks. Note that you can skip major ticks using NumberOfTicksPerLabel property.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.NumberOfTicksPerLabel
member.summary: Controls the number of ticks that are generated between two labels
member.remarks: The default value of this property is 1. Note that this property has effect only when you use automatic labels.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.Labels
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of strings used for axis labels.
member.remarks: This array contains the string which are visualized on major tick marks if the AutoLabels property is set to false.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.LabelGenerationMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a property indicating the number of levels for the scale labels
member.remarks: Settings this property to Stagger2 or Stagger3 will produce two or three levels of labels. You may consider to exclude the Stagger2 fit mode from the scale fit modes.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.LabelFitModes
member.summary: Gets or sets on array of label fit modes. When set to an empty array the control will not try to auto fit the axis scale labels

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.LabelValueFormatter
member.summary: Gets or sets the NValueFormatter object that formats the values displayed at the axis major ticks.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.LabelStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the scale label style controlling the appearance of scale labels

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.DisplayFirstLabel
member.summary: Gets/sets a value indicating whether the scale must display the first generated label

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.DisplayLastLabel
member.summary: Gets/sets a value indicating whether the scale must display the last generated label

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.LabelLevelTopPadding
member.summary: Gets or sets the top padding applied to the levels comprising the hierarchical scale

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.LabelLevelBottomPadding
member.summary: Gets or sets the bottom padding applied to the levels comprising the hierarchical scale

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.UseOrigin
member.summary: Specifies whether an origin value should be used for the automatically generated major ticks.
member.remarks: If set to true the Origin value is displayed by a major tick. If set to false the major ticks begin from the minimal scale value.

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.ScaleLevelBuildMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how the scale configurator will build scale levels

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.LabelsLevelFillStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the background fill style applied to the level containing the axis labels

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.OuterTicksLevelFillStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the background fill style applied to the level containing the inner ticks

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NStandardScaleConfigurator.MinorGridStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the style controlling the minor grid lines displayed by the scale

member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NAutoScaleBreak.ThresholdFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the threshold factor controlling when a break is generated
member.remarks: This property accepts values in the range (0, 1]. Smaller values reduce the distance between data points that is requied to generate a scale break, while bigger values increase it. For example if you set the threshold factor to 0.5 a scale break will occur if the maximum distance between data points exceeds half of the data points range.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of breaks that this scale break can generate

member.summary: Whether to use a custom min value to perform the threshold calculation on the data

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NAutoScaleBreak.MinValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom min value which can replace the data min value if UseMinValue is set to true

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NScaleSectionStyle.GetShowAtWall(Nevron.Chart.ChartWallType)
member.summary: Check whether the section range is shown on the specified chart wall.
member.returns: true if the stripe is shown, false if not

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NScaleSectionStyle.SetShowAtWall(Nevron.Chart.ChartWallType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Show the section range on the specified chart wall.
member.exception: Raised if a chart wall, which is invalid for this stipe was specified
member.remarks:
The component will raise an exception if you try to display the stripe on an invalid wall.
For the vertical axis stripes allowed chart walls are the vertical walls.
For the horizontal axis stripes allowed chart walls are the back, front and floor walls.
For the depth axis stripes allowed chart walls are the left, rigth and floor walls.
member.param: specifies whether to show the stripe or not

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this strip style will be interlaced (synchronized with the view order of the range sampler)

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NScaleStripStyle.GetShowAtWall(Nevron.Chart.ChartWallType)
member.summary: Check whether the stripe is shown on the specified chart wall.
member.returns: true if the stripe is shown, false if not

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NScaleStripStyle.SetShowAtWall(Nevron.Chart.ChartWallType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Show the stripe on the specified chart wall.
member.exception: Raised if a chart wall, which is invalid for this stipe was specified
member.remarks:
The component will raise an exception if you try to display the stripe on an invalid wall.
For the vertical axis stripes allowed chart walls are the vertical walls.
For the horizontal axis stripes allowed chart walls are the back, front and floor walls.
For the depth axis stripes allowed chart walls are the left, rigth and floor walls.
member.param: specifies whether to show the stripe or not

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.NContentScaleBreakPosition
member.summary: Represents a scale break position, which is determined according to the amount of data left on the sides of the scale break.
member.remarks: For example suppose you have 10 data items and the scale break is above 7 of them and below 3 of them. In this case the scale break position will be 70 percent from the scale length as this reflects the amount of data present in the left and right (top and bottom) parts of the scale. You may limit this percent by using the PercentRange property (by default set to [10, 90]). This is needed in order to avoid extreme cases where a scale break will be driven too close to the scale begin or end values thus diminishing the readability of the chart.

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NContentScaleBreakPosition.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NContentScaleBreakPosition.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Initializer constructor

member.name: P:Nevron.Chart.NContentScaleBreakPosition.PercentRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the allowed scale break split range.
member.remarks: By default this property is set to [10, 90]

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NWallDecoration.GetShowAtWall(Nevron.Chart.ChartWallType)
member.summary: Check whether the stripe is shown on the specified chart wall.
member.returns: true if the stripe is shown, false if not

member.name: M:Nevron.Chart.NWallDecoration.SetShowAtWall(Nevron.Chart.ChartWallType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Show the stripe on the specified chart wall.
member.exception: Raised if a chart wall, which is invalid for this stipe was specified
member.remarks:
The component will raise an exception if you try to display the stripe on an invalid wall.
For the vertical axis stripes allowed chart walls are the vertical walls.
For the horizontal axis stripes allowed chart walls are the back, front and floor walls.
For the depth axis stripes allowed chart walls are the left, rigth and floor walls.

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.CompareMethod
member.summary: Specifies the type of comparison to be used when filtering data using one of the Filter methods which has a CompareMethod argument.

member.name: F:Nevron.Chart.CompareMethod.More
member.summary: The filter will include all values which are larger than the comparison value.

member.name: F:Nevron.Chart.CompareMethod.Less
member.summary: The filter will include all values which are smaller than the comparison value.

member.name: F:Nevron.Chart.CompareMethod.Equal
member.summary: The filter will include all values which are equal to the comparison value.

member.name: F:Nevron.Chart.CompareMethod.MoreOrEqual
member.summary: The filter will include all values which are larger or equal to the comparison value.

member.name: F:Nevron.Chart.CompareMethod.LessOrEqual
member.summary: The filter will include all values which are smaller or equal to the comparison value.

member.name: F:Nevron.Chart.CompareMethod.NotEqual
member.summary: The filter will include all values which are not equal to the comparison value.

member.summary: Bottom right depth edge. Can be used for axes with depth orientation. Default position of the Depth axis.

member.summary: Top right depth edge. Can be used for axes with depth orientation.

member.summary: Top left depth edge. Can be used for axes with depth orientation.

member.summary: Bottom left depth edge. Can be used for axes with depth orientation.

member.summary: The primary zone is preferred when there is an ambiguity.

member.name: F:Nevron.Chart.AxisAutoDockZonePreference.AlternativeZone
member.summary: The alternative zone is preferred when there is an ambiguity.

member.summary: The zone that is nearer to the camera is preferred when there is an ambiguity.

member.name: F:Nevron.Chart.AxisAutoDockZonePreference.FartherZone
member.summary: The zone that is farther from the camera is preferred when there is an ambiguity.

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.LegendMode
member.summary: This custom type is accepted by the LegendMode property and controls the mode of the Nevron Chart for .NET integrated legend. When the LegendMode property is set to Disabled the legend is not shown. In Automatic mode the legend displays the presentation groups of the component. In Manual mode the user is able to fill the legend with custom data. See the Configuring the Legend topic for more information.

member.name: F:Nevron.Chart.LegendMode.Disabled
member.summary: the component does not show the legend

member.name: F:Nevron.Chart.LegendMode.Automatic
member.summary: the legend is automatically filled with items from the displayed series

member.name: F:Nevron.Chart.LegendMode.Manual
member.summary: the legend displays user defined information

member.name: T:Nevron.Chart.LegendExpandMode
member.summary: Defines the legend expand strategies, or in other words in which dimension will the legend grow when new items are added to the legend data item collection.

member.name: F:Nevron.Chart.LegendExpandMode.RowsOnly
member.summary: the legend expands by rows only. The legend has one column.

member.name: F:Nevron.Chart.LegendExpandMode.ColsOnly
member.summary: the legend expands by columns only. The legend has one row.

member.name: F:Nevron.Chart.LegendExpandMode.RowsFixed
member.summary: the legend has a fixed number of rows and expands in columns.

member.name: F:Nevron.Chart.LegendExpandMode.ColsFixed
member.summary: the legend has a fixed number of columns and expands in rows.

member.name: F:Nevron.Chart.LegendExpandMode.HorzWrap
member.summary: The legend wraps in the assigned bounds by increasing the number of row then the number of colums

member.name: F:Nevron.Chart.LegendExpandMode.VertWrap
member.summary: The legend wraps int he assigned bounds by increasing the number of columns then the number of rows

member.summary: Primary side. For a Y axis the left side is primary in all projections. For X and Z axes the bottom side is primary when the chart is viewed from the top and the top side is primary when the chart is viewed from the bottom.
